alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Clinton; Eaton; Gratiot; Ingham; Kalamazoo; Kent; Montcalm; Ottawa; Van Buren (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 05 at 9:12AM EDT until April 05 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Michigan, south central Michigan and southwest Michigan, including the following counties, in central Michigan, Gratiot and Montcalm. In south central Michigan, Calhoun, Clinton, Eaton, Ingham and Ionia. In southwest Michigan, Allegan, Barry, Kalamazoo, Kent, Ottawa and Van Buren. * WHEN...Until 315 PM EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 910 AM EDT, Radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Repeating thunderstorms are expected over Southwest Lower Michigan over the next few hours. Between 1.0 and 1.5 inches of rain has fallen in some areas this morning, with another 1.0 to 1.5 inches possible over the next several hours. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Calhoun; Clinton; Eaton; Gratiot; Ingham; Kalamazoo; Kent; Montcalm; Ottawa; Van Buren
